column4: I am using a horrible TSSTcorp Combo CD. Under Gentoo with HAL, I set a HAL fdi file to stop autodetect of the CD device. However it does not work under Ubuntu 9.10, while my system pauses from time to time.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/408965/ Here is my FDI file, how to make an equivalent settings in Ubuntu 9.10? Thank you.
is it listed in /etc/fstab?
no
/dev/scd0       /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 user,noauto,exec,utf8 0       0
what about in /etc/mtab?
sorry.
it has.
is it the one you mena?
you need to comment that line out and it won't get mounted at boot
well, in fact, there is no disc in my cdrom.
And the system stops from time to time.
I thought you didn't want the cd drive to automatically be mounted?
I want the system not checking my cd drive all the time.
it seems in the past HAL (in my gentoo) always check it and I disable it.
But is Ubuntu 9.10 using HAL?
afaik it is - and udev - how you control it is beyond me I'm afraid
I see. udev rules ...
and there is no good tools for me to manage it...
Thank you very much.
you could leave it unmounted and just mount it when you  need it
